request_pathways.name: Mail to PCHC Medical Records, P.O. Box 439, Bangor, ME 04402-0439

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: The organization directs patients to a Datavant/Swellbox online portal for records requests; a generic HIPAA authorization PDF exists on the server but is not linked from any patient-facing page.

red_flags: PDF form not linked from website — HIM page directs exclusively to third-party Datavant portal
Opt-out-by-striking defaults to broadest possible authorization for continuing communications and third-party-received records
Default mail delivery on CD — outdated medium many patients cannot use
bright_spots: Secure email delivery via PCHC's messaging portal with PDF format
Internal accountability checkbox requiring staff to flag partial or incomplete disclosures
Datavant/Swellbox online portal provides alternative digital pathway

findability.rationale: Level 3: The Datavant portal is accessible from the HIM page with moderate navigation effort, but the PDF form itself is effectively hidden — not linked from any patient-facing page and discoverable only via search engine.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The Datavant/Swellbox portal provides a digital submission pathway, but the org's own PDF form has zero fillable fields — creating one gap where a patient using the PDF must print, handwrite, and fax or mail it.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: The form is logically organized with clear section headers and good record-type granularity, but has notable clarity problems including dense legal prose and confusing opt-out-by-striking mechanisms that default to broadest authorization.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic authorization form for self-access by checking 'At my request,' but the form was designed for third-party release — patients must figure out which parts apply and navigate redisclosure warnings irrelevant to self-access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Strong compliance elements including oral revocation, non-conditioning statement, and proper 42 CFR Part 2 notices, with minor ambiguities around fee silence and no explicit citation of patient right of access under § 164.524.

overall.summary: PCHC provides an adequate records request experience through its Datavant portal but lacks a dedicated patient access pathway and offers only a non-fillable, generic authorization PDF that is not linked from its website.
